topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e7015763687276204a0100#post_53e7015763687276204a0100
Most of those "AK-47s" encountered by our troops and police are actually Chinese made "_Type-56_":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_56_assault_rifle, which is a copy of the AK-47. I've heard that Hollywood uses deactivated Type-56 rifles as prop AKs, as the genuine Russian-made Ak-47s are now expensive and rare. I think the Russians still use AKM, even though AK-74 is their standard issue.

Hell, Mosin Nagant and Sturmgewher-45 are still encountered in conflicts today.

topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e711aa6368725bfbc40000#post_53e711aa6368725bfbc40000
hey have to get back into water quickly. Just like the -Mudkips- mudskippers, lungfishes, and eels, which can be in dry air longer than most fishes due to their abilities to breath through skin. They're still fish.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e703096368721cbc810000#post_53e703096368721cbc810000
The AK series has a reputation for being reliable and resilient. Our Armed Forces finally began switching to M4s to replace the old M16s. I prefer the M16 though, it's what I'm most familiar with.
topics.author: 52f0834d63687261cba90300

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e71282636872279e010100#post_53e71282636872279e010100
Another thing: fish can actually breathe in air. In fact, they can extract oxygen from air better than they can from water. It's just that without water, their gills dry out and stop functioning, so they asphyxiate.
topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53e7145863687241cc7a0100#post_53e7145863687241cc7a0100
Actually scientists a while back implanted lungs into a fish and it was able to breathe; it died a little while later though cause it was a proof concept surgery to prove that organs not originating from the same species could be successfully implanted and not meant for it to live long.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: The "7.62Ã—54mmR":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/7.62%C3%9754mmR, originally designed for the Mosin Nagant, has the longest service life of all military cartridges in the world. They are still being used in Dragunov sniper rifles and surplus Mosin Nagant rifles in armed conflicts today.
